_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Entire System Reviewed as part of Daily Inspection
_prev_prog_3.Description: The following prevention program elements are applicable for the Farmer's Pride, Inc. ammonia refrigeration system. Standard operating procedures (SOP)have been developed for all internal maintenance work performed and personnel are required to follow the SOP. All refrigeration personnel working on the system are qualified and trained.  A  Ammonia Detection system is in place in order to detect any system release with detectors located throughout the facility. A refrigeration monitoring system alerts refrigeration personnel of any equipment problems or potentially unsafe conditions. An Emergency shutdown system allows any employee to quickly shutdown the refrigeration system to minimize a release. The refrigeration department conducts an inspection of the entire ammonia system daily.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmer's Pride, Inc. is a poultry processing plant located in Fredericksburg, PA. Farmers Pride processes approximately 1 million chickens into finished product per week. We are committed to supplying consumers with quality products and maintaining a safe work environment for our team members, visitors, and community. Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration systems. The refrigeration system is used to maintain the required temperatures in our coolers, freezers, and production rooms. The refrigeration system is a closed loop system with the ammonia contained within piping and vessels throughout our facility. Farmer's Pride, Inc. refrigeration system contains approximately 28,298 pounds of ammonia.



Accidental Release Prevention:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. has implemented many precautionary measures to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from its refrigeration system. Precautions include: a state of the art refrigeration monitoring system which alerts refrigeration personnel of any equipment problems or potentially unsafe conditions long before the potential for an ammonia release is reached, an ammonia detection system which alerts refrigeration department personnel at the first sign of a release, Emergency shutdown system which will allow any employee to quickly shutdown the refrigeration system to minimize a release. The refrigeration department conducts an inspection of the entire ammonia system daily. In addition, all maintenance personnel performing preventive maintenance on the system are qualified and thoroughly trained. Maintenance personnel are required to follow the written standard operating procedures (SOP) developed for each maintenance task performed on the system.  



Accidental Release Prevention Program: Farmer's Pride, Inc. has developed and maintains a Risk Management Program in accordance with EPAA?s rule 40 CFR 68 and a Process Safety Management program designed to comply with OSHA standards 29 CFR

1910.119. These programs include the following elements: process safety information, process hazard analysis (checklist), operating procedures, employee participation, training program, contractor safety program, pre-start up safety review procedures, mechanical integrity program, hot work permit procedures, management of change procedures, incident investigation procedures, compliance audit procedures.



Emergency Response Program:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. has a documented Emergency Response and Action plan that will be implemented in the case of an emergency at the Farmers Pride facility. This plan contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills/releases, fires, and other emergencies. The plan includes Emergency Recognition and Prevention, Pre-emergency planning and coordination with outside parties, Chain of Command, Reporting Requirement, Emergency Medical Care, as well as other critical information for the proper response to an emergency.

Farmers Pride maintains a fully trained HazMat response team and the necessary equipment to response to a hazardous material release. Farmers Pride fosters a good working relationship with local emergency responders by sponsoring plant tours and response planning sessions.



Five Year Accident History: Farmer's Pride Inc. has had no ammonia-related accidents in the past five years.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  Farmer's Pride, Inc. considers the safety of our employees and the community to be of the utmost importance. As a result of this concern Farmers Pride continuously evaluates the integrity of the ammonia system, equipment, and procedures, to identify potential safety improvements. Farmers Pride further develops improvement recommendations from inspections, safety meetings, review of industry experience, technology improvements, and employee suggestions. Recommendations are reviewed and if appropriate, corresponding action items are developed. Compliance audits are conducted interna
